A short while ago, the Connecticut State Department of Education released its comprehensive plan for the reopening of schools.

We understand that you have many concerns and questions about the 2020-2021 school year. We will be sharing the various reopening options in a timely manner as well as seeking your input as we move forward.

Please take a few minutes to read the latest from Superintendent Ruffin following the release of the state’s plan here: https://www.waterbury.k12.ct.us/News/2551#sthash.mAkb7FtQ.dpbs

Thank you for your continued support.

June 29 at 4:12 PM ·

Together, we lived through this pandemic’s disruption to PK-12 in a way we've not experienced in over a century. And together, we'll recover by maintaining a spirit of collaboration, the ability to adapt, and the willingness to accept each of our individual responsibilities to be part of the best possible solution for our students and school communities.

Ensuring access to an equitable education for every student while prioritizing the safety of all involved, “Adapt, Advance, Achieve: Connecticut’s Plan to Learn and Grow Together” is the first step in reimagining PK-12 for the 2020-21 school year: https://tinyurl.com/y78cjx7b.

In partnership with Waterbury Public Schools, the Symphony has developed an educational video series that focuses on French composer Camille Saint-Saëns’ celebrated “Le carnival des animaux (The Carnival of the Animals),” a musical suite in fourteen movements. Full of humor and fun, each movement uses instruments to depict an animal. In this second video, Music Director & Conductor, Leif Bjaland, and Principal Flutist, Kim DeLuccio Collins, take us on a visit to an aviary featuring Saint-Saëns’ “Volière (Aviary)” movement. We hope you enjoy the sounds of the birds!
